page.title: 06"The Haywain" Public House
page.content: My family live in a comfortable flat in a public house. My father is the publican of "The Haywain". The pub is about twenty three years old and was built on the site of an old farmhouse. It was named after a famous painting. We have renovated an old Gloucester Gambol and placed it in the front car park. About two hundred people visit each evening and sometimes my mum has to help. The most popular drinks are beer (70 p a pint) and wine (60 p a glass). People are also able to buy snacks and, if they wish, play darts, pool or cards. our special Sunday lunches are very popular. Claire Millichamp
